alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 7:17PM CST until February 02 at 6:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Amite River At Bayou Manchac Point affecting East Baton Rouge Parish. Amite River At Denham Springs affecting East Baton Rouge and Livingston Parishes. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Amite River At Denham Springs. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Flooding will begin in the westernmost parts of Denham Springs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM CST Monday the stage was 28.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 29.0 feet Wednesday morning then begin to fall. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
